confession.seduction_context: When angry that husband had sold grapes from vines at low price

timeline.subject: Margueritte Perisc
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed to seduction by devil, attending sabbat, killing animals, making hail

accomplices_named.name: Ydotte (sister of accused)
accomplices_named.context: Named accused before being executed; seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Claude Cagniel gendre de Jean Masson le viel

prior_accusations.context: Accused of killing a horse when she was at Remenoville

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Perisc
notable_quotes.french: ne scavoir la cause pourquoy elle est diffamée sinon que par commun bruict des personnes qui s'entrecommunique les uns aux autres
notable_quotes.english: Did not know the cause why she was defamed except by common rumor of people who communicate among themselves

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Perisc
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en estoit grandement aisé, et qu'il n'auroit plus de mal a l'entour de ladite vache
notable_quotes.english: That she was greatly pleased, and that he would have no more trouble around the said cow
notable_quotes.context: Allegedly said to her maid after Catherine Poirson's cow died

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Perisc
notable_quotes.french: que pour endurer la mort en sy peu de temps que ce n'estoit la peine qu'il failloit endurer la question, et que si elle venoit jusques a la qu'elle scavoit bien que aussi tost, qu'elle auroit dit ung mot qu'on luy feroit tout dire
notable_quotes.english: That to endure death in so little time it was not worth enduring the question [torture], and that if she came to it she knew well that as soon as she said one word they would make her say everything
notable_quotes.context: To Francois Louys at Moyen during her escape, explaining why she wouldn't confess

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Perisc
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne diroit rien, sinon tant qu'elle ne pourroit plus
notable_quotes.english: That she would say nothing, except when she could no longer [resist]

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Perisc
notable_quotes.french: que si elle scavoit qu'on ne luy doibvent faire grand mal, et que l'on ne luy fasse recognoistre dautres ses complices, qu'elle diroit qu'elle est telle comme on la tient
notable_quotes.english: That if she knew they would not do her great harm, and that they would not make her identify her accomplices, she would say that she is as they hold her to be
notable_quotes.context: During arrest, willingness to confess if not tortured or forced to name others

notable_quotes.speaker: Gerard Cherdot
notable_quotes.french: elle dit ce qu'elle veut, pour tascher de trouver les moyens de sortir de son affaire
notable_quotes.english: She says what she wants, to try to find the means to get out of her affair
notable_quotes.context: Response to accused's counter-accusations during confrontation

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine fille Vaultrin Anthoine
notable_quotes.french: n'y a jamais heu soupcon qui ce soit parce qu'elle n'y avoit nul interest
notable_quotes.english: Never had suspicion that it was [witchcraft] because she had no interest in it
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she didn't suspect the accused despite others thinking cow was bewitched

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes: cows straying into meix with compensation demands; herdsman role disputes (Demenge Broulland wanted husband removed from position); dispute over 4 gros for 'les vins' after sale of land; husband sold grapes at low price causing anger; customary gifts (tarts) to herdsman not given; court case over field damage by herd with grain eventually paid. Economic stress evident from accused's poverty and role as herdsman's wife.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Cows of witness strayed into accused's meix, she wanted compensation, witness threatened to bar her from shortcut through property
Maire Vernier opposed marriage of Didier Perisc to accused because her father and sister had been executed as witches
One of his cows became mingled with herd from Clayeures and was killed by wolf; he blamed Didier Parisc and wanted repayment

harms_catalog.harm_description: comme enragé, died after 3 or 4 days

6 weeks after ox death, husband warned herdsman to keep animals off wheat field, Parisc was angry, had to take him to court

harms_catalog.harm_description: field damaged by whirlwind which did not affect neighbors
fell ill suddenly, had to be killed
seriously injured by other animals while in the herd

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over rent of a garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: cow had been ill, Didier Perisc gave it a drink but it died
brouillartz (mists) to destroy grain and vines
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Margueritte Perisc (and other witches of Mouriviller)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jean Quezel took Didier Perisc to court for reparation when wheat field was spoiled by herd; eventually grain was paid as adjudged

legal_context.redress_outcome: Did not pursue case against Demenge l'Huillier for calling her witch, explaining he called her 'fille de genat' (daughter of condemned person) which she was
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Held in irons on hands and feet; escaped twice by breaking irons

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Initially ruled evidence insufficient and she should be released unless additional evidence produced (4 Aug, reiterated 23 Aug). After information amplicative, approved torture but restricted to question ordinaire only with suitable moderation (4 Sept). Approved death sentence (9 Sept).

hearsay_chains.content: Her small son had told how his father and mother went sometime to speak to a black animal at their trough
How his small brother had been severely beaten for telling story about parents talking to black animal
Didier Perisc said death of cows was by witchcraft
After husband told her cow was dead she replied she was greatly pleased and he would have no more trouble around the cow
He later suggested cow had been bewitched

emotional_state_notes: trembling when about to confess to Francois Louys

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Francois Query had stolen 'halbellai' belonging to a tennelier from house of miller at Clayeures
Francois Vicaire had wanted to stab her husband with a knife the previous year
Marie femme Claude Grand Jean of maltreating her stepchildren and leaving them hungry
Francoise femme Jean Quezel had cheated over payment at oven and had stolen a courbillon
Gerard Chardot was commonly reputed to have had intercourse with Anne femme Mongeot Maxant
Jean Quezel had killed a horse in anger
Didier Galland had bought a wife
In his service she received harm greatly and was hungry very often

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows strong pattern of community disputes centered around the accused's husband's role as herdsman and numerous animal deaths following quarrels. Accused had significant family history of witchcraft executions (father and two sisters). Change de Nancy initially ruled evidence insufficient twice, requiring additional testimony before approving limited torture. Accused demonstrated sophisticated understanding of judicial process, stating she knew that once she said anything under torture they would make her say everything. She escaped prison twice. Confession only obtained under torture (thumbscrews and rack). Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: her work history as domestic servant in multiple households, husband's position as herdsman (relatively low-status occupation), disputes over small amounts of money (4 gros), her statement about grapes sold at low price, and witness testimony about hunger during service. Healing practice indicated by her statement during confrontations that people should have asked her to cure animals, suggesting she claimed or was believed to have healing abilities. Language region is French based on location in Lorraine and all testimony in French.
